result.execSummary:
The defendant Gloria M Foster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $25.00 per month, starting 09-01-2015 or perform Community Service at $10.00 per hour.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Be involved in some activity.
Take Cognitive Thinking Course/Retail Theft Course.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  5 Days - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.
To be completed during the First 10 months of Probation.

Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Order on Petition for Early Discharge of Probation
dated 6/3/16 filed by State; position on early discharge recommendation.
From Court to State requesting position on early discharge recommendation.
dated 5/25/16 filed by Probation and Parole recommending early discharge of probation
Community service served (25 hours) in lieu of paying fine.
character letter from Julie Johnson filed by Attorney Rider
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Gloria M Foster in court with Attorney Andrew Rider.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rider makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes statements. Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Be involved in some activity
____Cognitivie thinking course/ Retail theft course
____20 Hours of Community Service-to be completed during 1st 10 months of probation
____Maintain a valid driver's license

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 9/1/15 or perform community service at $10.00 per hour).  As a condition of probation.

CONDITION TIME:  5 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 7/4/15 at 12:00 p.m.

OFF THE RECORDE Defendant Gloria M Foster in court with attorney Andrew Ryder for Tedia K. Gamino.  Tim Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case rescheduled due to scheduling conflict.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
